text.p: The following are top stories from selected Singapore newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Singapore Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong calls on Apec leaders to set 'intermediate milestones' along the road to free trade by 2020.
- Singapore government will spend Singapore $412 million to upgrade more than 68,000 Housing Board flats in 79 precincts.
- Malaysia willing to study a proposal to move its Singapore railway station to another location to allow land development.
- Sino-U.S. relations move forward with Clinton-Jiang meeting and announces reciprocal state visits next year.
- Urban Redevelopment Authority announces in its quarterly data that least 30 units each from 11 projects were sold from July 1 to September 30.
- Singapore Department of statistics releases its latest inflation figure which is slightly lower than September's rate of 1.5 percent.
- Canadian mining company Bre-X Minerals may face rival, U.S. Barrick Gold Corp in bid to control of the world's largest gold deposits in West Kalimantan.
- Up to five more initial public offerings are to hit the market before the year is out and a slew of foreign and local currency listings are expected to follow.
- Taiwan firms boost security on fear of mob hits.
- Singapore is seen as a U.S. $500 million multimedia market.
- Analysts say Malaysian Airline System Bhd's profit for the six months to September will rise only marginally amid costly expansion plan, declining yields and rising oil prices.
- Securities Commission approves Sateras Resources Bhd's proposal to acquire entire issued and paid-up share capital of Goon Institution Sdn Bhd.
